session.title: Simulation for Professional Services Agreement
session.jurisdiction_note: Contract governed by California law with specific provisions for termination, indemnification, and compliance.

timeline.title: Contract Signing and Board Approval
timeline.description: Agreement executed contingent on COMMISSION governing board approval
timeline.detailed_description: The Agreement takes effect upon signing but is not binding until approved by the COMMISSION's board. CONSULTANT must await notification to proceed from the Contract Manager.
risks: Delays if board approval is not obtained

timeline.title: Commencement of Work
timeline.description: CONSULTANT begins services after notification to proceed
timeline.detailed_description: Upon receiving notification from the Contract Manager, CONSULTANT starts work as per Exhibit A: Scope of Services. Progress reports must accompany each invoice.
risks: Late start may affect project timeline
Incomplete progress reports can delay payments

timeline.title: Monthly Invoice Submission
timeline.description: Invoices due within 45 calendar days after work performance
timeline.detailed_description: CONSULTANT submits itemized invoices including labor details, expenses, and progress reports. Invoices must be mailed to the Contract Manager at SCCRTC, 1523 Pacific Ave, Santa Cruz, CA.
risks: Late submission beyond 45 days may delay reimbursement
Incomplete invoices can result in payment holds

timeline.title: Progress Payment Due
timeline.description: Payments made monthly in arrears upon approval of work
timeline.detailed_description: COMMISSION processes payments based on satisfactory services and incurred costs. No payment for work before agreement approval or without deliverable completion.
risks: Payment delays if deliverables are not met

timeline.title: Compliance and Audit Review
timeline.description: Ongoing monitoring and potential audits during and after term
timeline.detailed_description: COMMISSION and state/federal auditors may review records for 5 years post final payment. CONSULTANT must maintain all books and documents for inspection.
risks: Non-compliance with audit requirements may lead to penalties
Failure to maintain records can result in contract termination

timeline.title: Agreement End or Termination
timeline.description: Contract concludes on specified end date or earlier termination
timeline.detailed_description: Agreement ends on the date specified unless terminated early per Section 4. CONSULTANT must submit final invoice within 60 days of work acceptance.
risks: Early termination costs apply if initiated by CONSULTANT

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Convenience by COMMISSION
exit_comparisons.penalty_text: Allowable costs incurred plus termination costs
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Payment for work done to date, no further claims

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Default by COMMISSION
exit_comparisons.penalty_text: Reprocurement costs plus all reasonable costs
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Liability for COMMISSION's costs, potential legal action

exit_comparisons.label: Termination by CONSULTANT with 120-day notice
exit_comparisons.penalty_text: Reprocurement costs plus all reasonable costs
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Liability for COMMISSION's costs, forfeiture of future payments

narratives.title: Ideal Performance Scenario
narratives.subtitle: All terms met without issues
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT performs all services satisfactorily, submits invoices on time with complete progress reports, and COMMISSION approves payments promptly. The agreement concludes on the end date with all deliverables accepted.
financial_impact: Total cost: As per Fee Schedule in Exhibit B

narratives.title: Default Termination Scenario
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT breaches agreement terms
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT fails to cure a breach within 10 days of written notice, leading COMMISSION to terminate for default. COMMISSION incurs reprocurement costs and seeks reimbursement from CONSULTANT.
key_points: Breach of contract terms not cured
financial_impact: Reprocurement costs: Estimated based on similar services
Legal fees: Variable based on dispute resolution
CONSULTANT liable for all reasonable costs
Potential additional damages if negligence involved

long_term.label: Year 1
long_term.description: Costs as per agreed Fee Schedule, no penalties if compliant

long_term.label: Year 2
long_term.description: N/A for typical term, unless extended by amendment

long_term.label: Post-Termination (5 years)
long_term.description: Audit and record-keeping costs if applicable, but no direct financial impact specified

risk_alerts.message: Insurance Compliance: Failure to maintain required insurance coverages can lead to immediate termination. Ensure all policies are endorsed with COMMISSION as additional insured and provide certificates before work starts.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Review insurance requirements in Section 6 and confirm compliance with all clauses, including post-agreement coverage for claims-made policies.

risk_alerts.message: Invoice Submission Deadline: Invoices must be submitted within 45 calendar days after work performance. Late submissions risk delayed payments and potential disputes.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Implement a tracking system to ensure timely invoice preparation and submission, including all required details per Section 2.H.

risk_alerts.message: Termination for Default: A breach not cured within 10 days allows COMMISSION to terminate and seek reprocurement costs, which could be substantial.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Monitor compliance closely and address any COMMISSION notices immediately to avoid default termination.

risk_alerts.message: Record Retention: Must maintain all books and records for 5 years post final payment for audit purposes. Non-compliance may result in penalties or contract termination.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Establish a secure record-keeping system that meets the requirements of Section 12 to facilitate audits and avoid disputes.

risk_alerts.message: Subcontracting Restrictions: No subcontracting without prior written authorization from COMMISSION, except as specified in Fee Schedule. Unauthorized subcontracting is a breach.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Seek written approval for any subcontracting not explicitly covered in the agreement to prevent violations.
